steps.title: Follow @richardbranson on Twitter and send him tweets.
steps.content: Follow @richardbranson on Twitter and send him tweets. Richard Branson is active on his personal Twitter account, on which he posts updates about his life and business ventures, shares bits of inspiration, and occasionally interacts with people. [1] X Research source After you follow him, send tweets directly to him or mention him in tweets that you write. Twitter is a very direct resource for talking to celebrities and other public figures, and if you’re lucky Richard may just respond to you! On Twitter, you can also send him a Direct Message, though this is not a guaranteed way of getting a response. If you don’t have a Twitter account, you will need to make one .

steps.title: Follow Richard Branson’s personal Instagram page, @richardbranson.
steps.content: Follow Richard Branson’s personal Instagram page, @richardbranson. Just like his Twitter, Richard Branson is fairly active on Instagram, which means this is another way you can directly contact him . [2] X Research source When he posts, comment on the pictures or respond to the captions. He may reply to your comment, especially if you ask an intriguing question or make an interesting point that catches his attention. You can make your own post and tag him in it. This may catch his attention. As on Twitter, you can send Direct Messages on Instagram, but this doesn’t mean that he will respond or even read the message.

steps.title: Like the Richard Branson Facebook page and comment on updates.
steps.content: Like the Richard Branson Facebook page and comment on updates. Though the option to contact him directly on Facebook is disabled, following Branson's public page is a good way to stay updated about him. [3] X Research source When posts are made or photos are uploaded, comment on them and you may get a response. His public page can be found at https://www.facebook.com/RichardBranson/ .

steps.title: Reach out to him on other social media platforms like YouTube and LinkedIn.
steps.content: Reach out to him on other social media platforms like YouTube and LinkedIn. Richard Branson’s personal page on the Virgin site lists Youtube and LinkedIn accounts that he uses. Though these social media platforms make it a little harder to talk with him directly as a public figure, there are still ways to reach out by following him and commenting on posts and updates. Branson's YouTube page can be found at https://www.youtube.com/richardbranson , and his LinkedIn is under his name.

steps.title: Write a respectful, enthusiastic letter that states your reason for contacting him.
steps.content: Write a respectful, enthusiastic letter that states your reason for contacting him. When dealing with more formal channels of communication than social media, you should be as respectful as possible—especially if you want a response! Address him politely, use proper grammar and stylistic conventions, and state plainly what you are trying to say. This will make the chances of a response or acknowledgement higher. If you're a fan of his, you can send him something like fan mail and talk about the impact he has had on you. If you have comments or questions related to business matters, you can send him mail to ask for advice or talk about how he operates his many ventures.

steps.title: Send business-related material as an email to his corporate email account.
steps.content: Send business-related material as an email to his corporate email account. Branson's business email is richard.branson@fly.virgin.com. This account is connected to his business profile at Virgin, so it would be the best place to send mail regarding business ventures, either yours or his. Because this is a business email, however, it may be monitored and filtered by an assistant, so your message to him may not get all the way to him.

steps.title: Send a more personal letter in the mail to his office address.
steps.content: Send a more personal letter in the mail to his office address. He has talked about loving receiving mail before, so this may be a good way to write a more personal note. [4] X Research source Address the letter to the attention of Sir Richard Branson at Virgin Management Limited, The Battleship Building, located at 179 Harrow Road, London, W2 6NB, UK.
